clinical_study.official_title: Protocol for the Electroencephalography Guidance of Anesthesia to Alleviate Geriatric Syndromes (ENGAGES-CANADA) Study: a Pragmatic, Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study examines the potential link between deep levels of anesthesia and delirium.

detailed_description.textblock: ENGAGES CANADA is a parallel study to the ENGAGES study which is currently underway in the USA. Due to the difference in practice models and types of anesthesia principles, ENGAGES CANADA is an important study. Delirium is a relatively common postoperative complication in the geriatric population, affecting 20% to 70% of surgical patients over the age of 60. Delirium manifests as confusion, inattention and the inability to think logically, and may affect the patient's postoperative healing and rehabilitation. It is associated with persistent cognitive decline, longer hospital stay, increased incidence of injurious falls, and increased mortality. Patients undergoing major cardiac surgery are at a significant risk of postoperative delirium. To date, there is no proven method to prevent postoperative delirium in this patient population and often delirious events remain unrecognized. Randomized controlled studies in diverse surgical patient populations suggest that intraoperative electroencephalography (EEG) guidance during general anesthesia may decrease postoperative delirium and adverse postoperative outcomes. Patients who experience postoperative delirium report persistently decreased quality of life and it is a risk factor for incident psychiatric disorders and psychotropic medication use. One potential key mechanism in the relationship between delirium and incident psychiatric illness may be the experience of dissociation (disturbed awareness, impaired memory, or altered perceptions) in the perioperative period in those who are delirious. The co-occurrence of psychiatric illness and delirium can put older adults at greater risk of negative long terms effect such as functional decline. This study will compare the effectiveness of two anesthetic protocols in reducing postoperative delirium and postoperative health-related quality of life in a high risk population.We expect that EEG-guided anesthetic management of patients during their operative procedure will result in improved health-related outcomes, specifically decreased incidence of postoperative delirium and improved postoperative mental and physical health outcomes. The publication of ENGAGES CANADA will include a predefined meta-analysis with ENGAGES-US.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of delirium will be compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group as measured by the numbers of positive Confusion Assessment Method (CAM) scores.

secondary_outcome.description: Time (days) measured between the first and last positive CAM assessments and compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group.
Severity of delirium will be compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group. As assessed by the CAM-S severity score

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of mortality at 30 days
other_outcome.description: Incidence of mortality (%) will be compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group at 30 days

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of mortality at 1 year
other_outcome.description: Incidence of mortality (%) will be compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group at 1 year

other_outcome.measure: Length of ICU stay
other_outcome.time_frame: Time (days) in ICU from Post-Operative Day (POD) 1 to 5 (or through study completion at one year)
other_outcome.description: Length of ICU stay (days) will be compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group.

other_outcome.measure: Length of hospital stay
other_outcome.time_frame: Time (days) from admission to discharge from hospital (or through study completion at one year)
other_outcome.description: Length of hospital stay (days) will be compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group.

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of falls at 30 days
other_outcome.description: Number of falls will be recorded by patient interview at 30 days and compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group.

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of falls at 1 year
other_outcome.description: Number of falls will be recorded by patient interview at 1 year and compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group.

other_outcome.measure: Patient-reported pain scores by Visual Analogue Score
other_outcome.description: Total Visual Analogue Scores for pain at rest for POD 1 to 5 will be compared between the Control Group and the EEG-Guided Group

other_outcome.measure: Relationship between clinical CAM-ICU and rigorous delirium assessments
other_outcome.description: Delirium assessments made by study investigators will be compared to routine delirium assessments done by nursing staff in intensive care units.

other_outcome.measure: Association between delirium and falls
other_outcome.description: The overall incidence of delirium as assessed by CAM vs the incidence of falls by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between delirium and anxiety/depression
other_outcome.description: The overall incidence of delirium as assessed by CAM vs the incidence of anxiety/depression as measured by PHQ-4, by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between delirium and cognitive status by SBT
other_outcome.description: The overall incidence of delirium as assessed by CAM vs cognitive status as assessed by the Short Blessed Test, by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between delirium and cognitive status by PROMIS Applied Cognition
other_outcome.description: The overall incidence of delirium as assessed by CAM vs cognitive status as assessed by the PROMIS Applied Cognition measure, by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between delirium and cognitive status by PROMIS Cognition General Concerns
other_outcome.description: The overall incidence of delirium as assessed by CAM vs cognitive status as assessed by the PROMIS Cognition General Concerns measure, by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between delirium and traumatic events by PCL-5
other_outcome.description: The overall incidence of delirium as assessed by CAM vs history of traumatic or stressful events as assessed by the PCL-5 measure, by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between delirium and quality of life by PROMIS Global Health
other_outcome.description: The overall incidence of delirium as assessed by CAM vs quality of life as assessed by the PROMIS Global Health measure, by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between depth of anesthesia by BIS and mortality rate
other_outcome.description: Depth of anesthesia measured by the bispectral index vs mortality rate by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between depth of anesthesia by BIS and MI
other_outcome.description: Depth of anesthesia measured by the bispectral index vs incidence of myocardial infarction by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between depth of anesthesia by BIS and ICU length of stay
other_outcome.description: Depth of anesthesia measured by the bispectral index vs ICU length of stay (days) by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Association between depth of anesthesia by BIS and stroke
other_outcome.description: Depth of anesthesia measured by the bispectral index vs incidence of stroke by an adjusted regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Co-variates of delirium
other_outcome.description: Logistic regression models will be used to determine independent co-variates of postoperative delirium.

other_outcome.measure: Predictors of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by PDEQ
other_outcome.description: A regression model will be used to assess independent predictors of PTSD as assessed by the PDEQ measure.

other_outcome.measure: Predictors of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by PDI
other_outcome.description: A regression model will be used to assess independent predictors of PTSD as assessed by the PDI measure.

other_outcome.measure: Meta-analysis for incident delirium
other_outcome.description: A meta-analysis will be performed with data from ENGAGES-US and ENGAGES-Canada to test whether EEG-guidance of anesthesia decreases postoperative delirium.

arm_group.description: Patients will undergo standard anesthesia as per standard of care in this patient population.

Practitioners will attempt to follow the EEG-Guided protocol to limit the incidence of EEG burst suppression by modifying administration of anesthesia. The EEG-guided protocol is suggestive rather than prescriptive, and practitioners will exercise judgment depending on the clinical situation.
